characters: BEDROOM, THE GLASS OF WATER HAS CHANGED BACK TO THE GREEN
IN ONE LONG TAKE, WHILE WALKING FROM THE KITCHEN TO THE
MARTHA SLOWLY WAKES UP. SHE IS LYING ON HER STOMACH ON
TURNS BACK TO LOOK BUT IT'S HARD TO MOVE. SHE CATCHES A
COLD CEMENT. THERE ARE HUNDREDS OF CANDLES ON THE FLOOR.
INT. FARM HOUSE DINING AREA- MORNING
GLIMPSE OF PATRICK, LEANING OVER HER DRIPPING SWEAT.
THE CAMERA FOLLOWS HER AS SHE DIVES UNDER WATER.
SHE IS DISORIENTED AND FEELS SOMEONE ON TOP OF HER. SHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a hot summer day. A large run down farm house, several sheds, a red roof barn and a decrepid silo sit between fields of dry, uncut grass, in a serene isolated valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO MEN tack together a broken fence that encloses an overgrown paddock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE WOMEN work in a vegetable garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO WOMEN hang wet clothes on a clothes line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO MEN work in a cluttered garage on an old car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOUR WOMEN sit in a circle on a broken down, buckling front porch. One woman breast feeds a new born. The others knit a large blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO WOMEN and TWO MEN swim naked in a swimming hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN in his forties sits alone in a room reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN chops wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bare foot TODDLER plays alone in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large room with unfinished wood walls has several blankets and pillows laid out like beds on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO WOMEN are in the kitchen preparing food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARTHA, sets a table for eight. Martha is beautiful but appears run down. She is 24 years old but her weathered face makes her look older. A bell rings off screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men sit around a table eating dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One man sits at the head of the table, this is PATRICK. Patrick is older than the other men. To his right is WATTS, a man in his early twenties with a greasy patchy beard. 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women are scattered around the kitchen waiting. The men finish dinner, pass through the kitchen and walk outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women file into the dining room, clear the men's dishes, put more chairs around the table, and bring out a new serving of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women sit around the table eating very small portions of low protein food. Katie sits at the head of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen is filled with dishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO BABIES sleep next to each other in an old broken crib. A teenage girl sleeps on the floor next to the crib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are strewn all over the house sleeping. Suddenly, a figure passes quickly through frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha walks out the front door, across the porch, and up the driveway. She carries a small bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her pace becomes increasingly faster. She looks back to see a teenage girl, SARAH, standing in the window watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha turns and walks faster, heading straight for the woods. As she gets to the edge of the trees she begins to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off screen, the house DOOR SLAMS SHUT. A MAN urgently yells out: "MARCY MAY"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera holds on the trees shaking gently in the wind. For a moment everything is quiet. 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, A MAN and TWO WOMEN enter frame and run into the woods, chasing after Martha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woods are dark. Martha runs as fast as she can. She hears the MAN's voice calling her from a distance. A man and two women are chasing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha arrives at a steep heavily wooded hill. She keeps running at full speed, then slips, falls, and rolls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha ducks behind a fallen tree and looks back to see the group arrive at the ridge to survey the woods and begin their descent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha holds still, listening as the people chasing her pass by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha uses a pay phone at a diner. She dials and waits. She is struck by the voice that answers, she transforms from being a zombie to being flooded with emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god! Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure. Upstate I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in New York?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you get back? 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha doesn't know what to say, she bursts into tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha? What's wrong? What's happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I should go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go, I can't stay gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Don't go. What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry for calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha! Don't hang up. Please! Do not hang up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to come get you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait that long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Tell me where you are and I'll come right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, you don't have to-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see you Martha. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha sits alone in a booth hunched over a grilled cheese sandwich and french fries. She devours the food like she hasn't eaten in days. 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entrance bell rings. Martha turns around and cautiously peers over the booth. A FAMILY walks in. They are seated. Martha returns to eating.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Marcy May?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is Watts. His voice paralyzes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha stops eating. He slides into the booth and sits across from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts reaches over and takes some french fries. He eats them slowly, enjoying every bite. She can't look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were worried about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick's worried about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to come into town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could've brought you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the woods?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress goes to take Martha's plate. Watts puts his hand out to stop her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You not gonna eat that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts takes the half grilled cheese sandwich and stuffs it into his mouth. The waitress clears the plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts takes Martha's napkin and wipes the grease from his hands and mouth while he chews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress drops the check on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts stares at Martha for another moment before reaching into his pocket to pull out a mess of small papers. He sorts through them and separates a $20 bill. He stuffs the rest of the papers back into his pocket. He grabs her hand, places the money in her palm and grips it closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets go. Her hand goes limp and the money falls on the table. She does not look at him. He leans in and forces eye contact with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts, growing increasingly tense, stands up and glances around the diner. It is very busy. He does not want to make a scene in front of all these people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans down and kisses Martha on the cheek. She doesn't kiss back. He holds his forehead to her forehead until she reacts. She reluctantly kisses him on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha watches him walk outside. As soon as his back is turned, she gets up, runs through the diner, and suddenly cuts through the kitchen. 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha sits on the ground hiding between two benches at an empty bus stop. She does not look well. She turns and vomits behind the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha hides between two parked buses. She watches a BLACK BMW pull into the parking lot. LUCY, a well dressed woman in her early 30's, gets out of the car. Martha walks towards Lucy. Lucy rushes over and hugs Martha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha, wrapped in Lucy's sweater, leans her head against the window watching the road behind her in the side view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy notices that Martha's left ear is bruised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were pretty upset on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I over reacted. 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he hurt you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy is skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you guys break up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long were you together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A while. 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe a year, maybe more or less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you were here the whole time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been back in New York for over a year and you haven't called me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy is upset but manages to remain calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm glad you're here now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy makes the bed. Martha enters the room wrapped in a towel. Her hair drips on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made you some tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy takes a small hand towel and dries Martha's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted should be up from the city soon. He'll cook us some dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty tired, is it okay if I just go to bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some sleep, you'll be as good as new tomorrow. 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy leaves. Martha gets under the sheets wrapped in her wet towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy sits at the kitchen table with a glass of RED WINE. The front door opens. She puts on a smile as TED enters. He speaks with a BRITISH ACCENT. He sets down his bag and gives her a hug and a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seems okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did she say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much, she's pretty tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's she been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had some boyfriend, they were living in the Catskills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. She's here now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted keeps his comments to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how long's she staying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you she was fine. You spend all that time worrying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted kisses her on the forehead and walks to the liquor cabinet and pours a scotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is completely dark. Martha finds her way through the hallway and into the kitchen. She drinks water from the faucet with an insatiable thirst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen has large windows, through which a bright spot light, lights the porch but pitch black darkness is beyond that. Martha is scared to look outside. She forces herself to slowly turn and look. She puts her head down and quickly returns to her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha is wrapped in a wet towel sleeping on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha? Why are you on the floor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha does not know where she is. A moment passes before she starts to come to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, you were in a deep sleep. Come have some breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy and Ted eat at the kitchen table. Martha enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha! Welcome!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great to finally meet you. You sleep alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you like the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a rental.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy puts some eggs on a plate for Martha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice. I didn't know there was a lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Do you still like to swim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't live in the city anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do. This is for weekends and holidays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Lucy eat, Martha takes miniscule bites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted's finishing a new building down town and when it's done we're taking one of the new apartments. You want to see pictures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy gets up from the table and walks to another room. Martha sniffs her food. Ted doesn't notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think she's excited to have you back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy re-enters with her digital camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the view, the interiors are obviously not finished. It's nice right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were supposed to move in the spring but construction halted, so, it'll just be a little while longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep, just a little while longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, sorry, no more work talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy notices that Martha isn't eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you've got to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, I can fix you something later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha, feeling on the spot, forces down a big bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha sits cross legged on a sun bed looking out to the lake. Ted naps while Lucy sun bathes reading THE MOTHER OF ALL BABY BOOKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connecticut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy is confused. She tries to make sense of the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean where I picked you up? 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About 3 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wondered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy goes back to reading. Martha lies down and stares at the sky. A light banging sound starts to echo over the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SOUND IS THE SAME AS THE LAKE: A light breeze in the trees and the water gently hitting the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and two men build a fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha lies in the open field smoking cigarettes with ZOE, a girl in her early twenties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha is younger, more energetic and confident. They are laughing and talking when Zoe notices Patrick walking towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put out your cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They put out their cigarettes. Zoe buries them in the grass. Patrick approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this Martha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick crouches down over Zoe but smiles at Martha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. You've got a really nice place here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's as much yours as it is mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances at her legs, then back up to her face. He turns his attention to Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you quit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't apologize to me, it's your body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick gestures towards Martha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look after this girl properly Zoe, she deserves some real care for once in her life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's been great, everyone's been great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like a Marcy May. 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcy was my grandmothers name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues to walk through the field. Zoe and Martha recline into the grass and continue talking.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm going for a dip. Anyone want to join?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha stands up and brushes herself off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha turns to Zoe but Lucy is there instead, lying on the sun bed, lost in her book. Lucy does not answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted runs down the dock and dives into the water. Martha follows. Ted looks back to see Martha stand at the end of the dock, take off her clothes and dive in naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha swims, lost in her own world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy notices Martha, grabs a towel, and walks down to the end of the dock. Ted swims back and gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brilliant choice of swim wear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy is not amused. Ted walks away laughing. He turns to sneak one more glimpse of Martha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha! What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you put some clothes on, you can't swim naked. 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just can't. There are kids around and people come by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you can't. We don't, just don't. I have a bathing suit you can borrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha gets out of the water. Lucy wraps the towel around her and walks away. Martha dries off. She feels embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha sleeps. Lucy notices the bruising on Martha's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been trying to wake you. You should get up or you won't sleep through the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. I'm just going to sleep a little more first okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm sorry I got frustrated with you before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy leaves. Martha opens the window and dumps the pasta outside then goes back to sleep. 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in a really deep sleep. I can't wake her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seems a bit off, no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's just really tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's had a bad breakup. I want to give her a couple days to get situated, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has she always been like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pain in my ass, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha sits up in bed wide awake. She turns and stares out her window into the dark trees that surround the lake house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OLD BROWN CAR pulls out of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha sweeps the front porch. She notices the car pull away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX, A young man in his early twenties, comes outside and sits down next to her. Max is warm, nice, and care free. He's not very bright but he is a good time to be around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Marcy. 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do they go at night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I never get invited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jumps over the banister and reaches under the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to have a drink with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out a little flask and shakes it. A mischievous smile grows on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't be back for a few hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't. I'm not going to drink for awhile, I think it's a good idea for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.
