dialogues.text: He swats it out of her hand and scolds her. After a moment he puts his forehead to her forehead and caresses her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't stare!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe walks back to the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He's right. I don't know why I'm so weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not. You'll quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OLD BROWN CAR pulls into the driveway. A YOUNG GIRL, no more than fifteen years old gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name's Sarah I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO WOMEN welcome SARAH and walk her into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should handle her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're ready. Zoe can help but you'll be great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha sits in the passenger seat, Lucy drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha notices a BROWN CAR is parked at the top of the  driveway on the side of the road. Martha is troubled by  the parked car's presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose car was that?  40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a hiking trail, people leave  their cars there all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy looks through produce. Martha takes the cart and runs down the isle with it. She picks her feet off the ground so she is riding on the cart. Lucy is amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha turns around and goes faster, flying all the way down the isle. A good looking YOUNG MAN walks into the isle. Martha almost hits him with the cart but she slams her feet on the floor and just misses him. Lucy runs up and takes the shopping cart back. Martha doesn't say anything, she just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young man walks down the isle. Martha watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to hurt someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha is distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you go get me a large jug of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with the tap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like bottled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a waste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you get it or not? 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha walks through the refrigerated section looking for water. She notices the Young Man walking behind her. She stops to get water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops to buy beer. He looks at her. She grabs the water and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha and Lucy get into the car in the grocery store parking lot. Martha watches the rear view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know that guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy in the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one you almost ran into? No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was looking at me like he knew me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you say something to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, you tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was staring at me like he knew me, did you talk to him about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Jesus. The guy was checking you out  Martha! Relax. (Lucy starts the car.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't want guys to drool all over you, then wear more clothes-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just drive the car Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy is unpacking groceries. Ted enters. Lucy puts something in a cupboard. Ted takes it out and puts it in a different cupboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we should have the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's labor day, we always have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are just too stressful right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already invited clients.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure people would understand-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just think it would be best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For who, Martha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For all of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not an option! We're having the  party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's the end of it, because you say  so.  43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha shows Sarah a large walk in closet. Martha puts  Sarah's clothes on a shelf with all the other clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We share all of this, if it fits, you can  wear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk into a small bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where we sleep. You can take any  bed that's open or you can sleep  downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk downstairs. And see another large bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry, can we eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't eat until the evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the bottom of the stairs, several make shift beds are  laid out on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get used to it. Your body doesn't  need that much food. You're taught to  overconsume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a baby asleep in the crib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's beautiful. Whose the mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie's, but we all help out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Patrick the father?  44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look just like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the kids here are boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha picks one up, she is very natural with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He only has boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to hold him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to take care of them do I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you don't want to. There are  plenty of jobs to be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll find your role. It takes time for  people to find their role in a new  family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha walks with Sarah and Zoe across the courtyard and  out into the field towards the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called my dad today to ask for money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Patrick know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked me to. Sometimes, if there's  something we really need I'll call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was it?  45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, they're not bad people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he give you the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He thinks I'm on drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you tell him you're not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's why he gives it to me. I guess  he'd rather pay for it than think I'm  sucking dick for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done drugs. Not a lot but I've tried  everything pretty much, except heroin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to try everything at least  once. You find out who you are that way.  What about drinking, do you drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have, but I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, we don't drink. It just makes you  angry and less focused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get the wrong idea Sarah. We don't  talk to our old families.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't call my Dad anyway, no matter  how much he paid me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Watts walk out of the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Patrick, Did you meet Sarah yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie teaches Martha how to make a vegetable drink. Martha adds some herbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie hands her a large chalky white pill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half is fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha breaks the tablet in half and drops it into the drink. She crushes it with a spoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha is back at the Lake house. Lucy enters and begins to load the dishwasher. Martha holds the glass with the green drink which we now see is just water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do these if you want to go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha leaves. Holding the glass tightly, Martha walks to her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha enters her bedroom holding the green drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sits in a chair wearing a WHITE ROBE. The room is no longer Martha's bedroom at the lake, it is a small dark room at the farm. 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is nervous. Martha brushes Sarah's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I have to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing you don't want to. Drink this, it will help you relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah takes a sip of a thick green drink. She gags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's herbal. It's the start of your cleansing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha lifts the bottom of the glass to force it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've all done it so you know there's nothing to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have to wear this robe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it seems a bit silly, but it's a part of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah looks very uncomfortable. She is getting light headed from the drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look amazing. It's your special night with him, enjoy it, you'll be great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha helps Sarah up and passes her through a door to the next room. She removes Sarah's robe and lays her on the ground. Martha shuts the door locking her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha lies down on the floor and curls up into a ball. 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha wakes up wearing Lucy's dress. She has wet herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha takes off the dress and stuffs it between the mattress and the box spring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha sits alone on the steps looking out onto the water. She is deep in thought. Lucy walks down the stairs and sits next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we start cooking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just made some potato salad. Ted's cooking the fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we were going to cook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cooked last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha is lost deep in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you ever have this thing where you can't tell if something's a memory or if it's something you've dreamed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you blame me for anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what? 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just trying to figure out why we stopped talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were far apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I wonder if, maybe I could have taken better care of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The past doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took care of myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you did. I think I could have done more though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be honest with me, you never think about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not angry at me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you don't think much of me but I knew what I was doing then and I still do. 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Martha, I think the world of you, I'm  just wondering if I should have come back  and kept you in school and helped you go  to college, you had so much potential.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need your guidance, I never did.  I'm a teacher and a leader, you just never let me be that but now I know I am, I know who I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teacher and a leader? What are you talking about? I always encouraged you to  do more, but you shut me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha doesn't respond she drifts off into deep thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because we're sisters doesn't mean we need to talk about everything that comes into your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, Lucy and Martha eat at the dinner table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are your plans Martha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you thinking about what you can do for work? 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're at an age where you need to start thinking about a career.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a part of adult life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are other ways to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. People don't need careers, people should just exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just saying we should start talking about what you're interested in. Maybe we can help you get some ideas together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have moments when I would love to move to France and just exist but it doesn't work that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do that if you want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault but you learned that success is measured by money and possessions. It's just not the right way to live. 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy is floored by Martha's response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do you think the right way to live is? Being a hysterical mess and causing your family pain. You're eating my food and sleeping under my roof so watch your mouth. You're rude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha, with a frightening streak of viciousness stands up to Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Lucy are speechless. Martha leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha sneaks downstairs in the middle of the night. Ted and Lucy are asleep in their room. Martha picks up the phone and dials a number. A WOMAN picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She not there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Marlene Lewis. Who's this. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha hangs up. The phone rings. She unplugs the phone and collapses on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha and the others are practicing pick pocketing. Martha looks out into the feild to see Patrick talking with Sarah. She is enamoured by him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe, Martha, Sarah and MAX are shooting bottles in the  woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts said I'm supposed to teach you how  to defend yourselves but I think you're  hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm surprised your dumb ass even knows  how to load it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I'm like Doc fuckin' Holiday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe shoots and hits a bottle. He comes up behind Zoe,  wraps his arms around her, kisses her neck and gropes her breasts. She moves his hands away. Sarah watches on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, you are so hot when you shoot, makes  my willy hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max takes the gun out of her hand and fires several  shots. He misses the bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened Doc? I should be teaching  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loads another round, aims, shoots, and hits a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, my turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max wraps his hands around hers so she is firmly gripping the gun.  54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright Max, was this just an excuse to  grope Marcy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm teaching her how to shoot.  Then you just squeeeeeeeeeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick is walking towards them carrying a sac. Martha  fires a few shots and misses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Focus. Take a deep breath. Think about  someone who wronged you. Feel it, feel  how they made you feel in your stomach.  Take a deep breath, feel it all moving  out into your hands. Let it build. It's  transferring to the gun, building in the  gun. Now release.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fires five powerful shots quickly, one shatters. A  smile grows on martha's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feels good right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha nods. Patrick opens a sac and lets 2 cats out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now try that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're living animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, shoot Max then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick lifts Martha's hand so the gun is pointing at  Max. Max is frozen, he smiles awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is confused, he gets embarrassed.  55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't walk away from me Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stops. Martha drops the gun down to her waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat has terminal cancer, it's in  excruciating pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max has no substance, he's just here to  free load and be around the girls but  you're a teacher and leader, you just  don't see it because no one let you  believe it before me. You're a leader a  Marcy, now prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha is shook up. She does not fire the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat reminds you of some fluffy thing  you think you used to love. You're  holding on to some false emotion that  stops you from doing what's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe takes the gun out of Martha's hand. The gun goes off. Martha and Max jump. Zoe shot the cat without blinking.  She hands the gun back to Martha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could spend my life being selfish,  living alone, using this gift for me but  I've sacrificed myself to be what you all  need me to be. You need to trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you shouldn't need me to explain  everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gun shot goes off. They all look up. Max looks  mortified, he has shot the other cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do?  56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it was sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of them was sick, Zoe knew which one  it was!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max tosses the gun and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha looks for Max. She finds him in the hay loft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll probably leave this place soon  anyways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got places. My cousin lives in  Bennington, he said I could go up there  and make like, $500 a week selling weed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what I do. I'm sick of all  these rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, they're not rules. It's just common  sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It feels like rules. They won't let me do  anything. I can't even go on the house  runs. I'd be great at taking shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not about taking shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like it's about taking shit to me.  57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's why you don't get to come.  You just don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to quit drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha takes the bottle out from under a hay bale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still living with all the shit you  carried out there. You're the only one,  let it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You can't try. You have to stop. They  love you, they just want you to be  stronger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm strong, they'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max leans up and tries to kiss her. Martha stops him. She hugs him instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rock is hurled onto the roof of the house. THUMP. It rolls down and off into the yard. Flood lights shine up at a beautiful large country home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE PEOPLE run through the yard, dashing through the light and back into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is Martha, Watts, and Zoe, hurls another rock onto the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man inside comes to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe picks up a rock and throws it onto the roof. The man in the window walks towards his front door. Watts leads Martha towards the house. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man in the house comes out of his front door, walks around the side of his house and looks up to see what's hitting the roof. He leaves the front door open. Watts and Martha creep into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha and Watts walk through the house. They sneak past a living room where a woman watches television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are two place settings at the dinning room table and two candles burning in vintage, steel candle holders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts blows out the candles, pours wax on the table and lays the candles down. He steals the candle holders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a large painting on the wall. He motions for Martha to help him. They get on either side and dismount the painting, then lay it face up on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hear the man come inside and talk to his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue to creep through the house, into the kitchen and out the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha, Watts, Zoe, Max and a few others have sex with each in the same room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick walks down stairs and sits quietly in the corner watching them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha lies awake in her room. She hears a car outside.  She creeps to her window and peeks out. She can't see  what kind of car it is. It leaves the lights and engine  on for a moment, then it shuts off. No one gets out. She  is frozen with fear. She builds up courage then leaves her room. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha walks through the dark lake house, looking out the windows trying to see if anyone is coming, almost as if she is standing guard. She is trembling with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark figure crosses from one room to another behind her. She freezes, turns and holds her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man walks out of the room. Martha screams. It's Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ you scared me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take a moment to calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I wake you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I can't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither. I was going to watch a movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to watch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should try to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It always helps me. It's better than lying in bed awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a couple of beers out of the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted sits on one end of the couch, Martha on the other end. He wears his robe and drinks a beer. He glances over at Martha who is lost in the movie, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about before, Martha. 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright. It's your house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha lies down. He offers her a pillow. She raises her head and he puts it under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy walks into the living room to find Martha curled up on the couch next to Ted. The TV is on and there are three empty beer bottle on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy is furious. She picks up the bottles and walks into the kitchen, being sure to make as much noise as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Martha wake up. Martha sits up on the couch and watches Ted walk into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy puts on the kettle. Ted comes into the kitchen and opens the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to make some breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted follows her into their room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Lucy enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can not be serious right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy! 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One minute you're going after Martha at the dinner table, then you're curling up together on the couch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one was curling up with anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really do think I'm stupid don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, I couldn't sleep, I was watching a movie, she came out and sat down and started watching with me. What am I supposed to do, tell her to leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're being ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can lose your temper at will but when I get pissed off, I'm being crazy or ridiculous! I couldn't possibly be mad for a reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy gets undressed and gets in the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you accusing me of something? Because if you are, I'd like you to say it out loud so you can hear how absurd it sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. I just want you to think about how walking in on that might make me feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ask me to make more of an effort. I try to do that and you get upset. I can't win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted runs. 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy sits on the steps overlooking the lake. She is sneaking in a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha stands below her bedroom window to see what's hitting the roof at night. She turns and looks over to  the back road. The brown car is parked on the side road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is overcast. It looks like a storm is approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha walks towards the car, her anger is building. As she gets to the top of the road she picks up a rock and throws it through the car window. Glass shatters everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up a loose shard of glass and scrapes a line on the side of the car. She drops the glass and stares at the mess for a moment before looking around to make sure no one has seen her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha looks out the window at the brown car with the smashed window. It is raining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha lies in bed. Something thumps on the roof. Martha flinches. THUMP. THUMP. THUMP. She flintches with each thump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha helps Lucy clean the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I don't smoke. 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Especially if you're trying to have a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should mind your own business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings. It startles Martha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't deal with talking to anyone right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha is frozen, watching the phone ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy fixes Martha's hair and puts make up on her. Martha sits passively like a doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha walks down the stairs, she looks beautiful. She is wearing a long white dress, Lucy has done her hair and make up. She is cautious as she descends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guests have arrived. They are drinking cocktails and talking in the house and on the back porch. Jazz plays over speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha walks outside. Lucy introduces her to some of her friends. Martha looks like a zombie though, frozen at the sight of so many strangers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha continues to walk around the edge of the party quietly observing everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something catches her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is studying the BARTENDER. She composes herself then approaches him cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's you name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry? 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts out his hand to shake hers. She takes a half step back and studies his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points at the tequila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands there looking dazed. She doesn't respond. He just pours it. He is confused by her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you weren't supposed to drink Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her the tequila. She suddenly slaps it out of his hand. The glass shatters on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're so fucking smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha storms inside. Lucy follows her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what happenind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all need to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a fucking liar. We all need to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to the bartender. 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy lowers Martha's pointing hand and tries to move her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to leave. We all have to leave. I know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to live with this Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted approaches and helps guide Martha into their bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy turns around to check the party. People are starting to notice. Lucy and Ted force Martha back into their bedroom. He closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha is frantic, she begins to hyperventilate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy tries to hug her, Martha squirms free. Lucy hugs her again and pulls her onto the bed, trying to get her to calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch me, you're not listening to me! 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha please try to breath. I don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted walks into the bathroom and gets pills. He forces them down and makes Martha drink water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She calms down. She falls back onto the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Lucy look exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha walks through a large house in the dark. She gets to the front door and opens it letting in Katie, Zoe, Watts and Patrick. They immediately scatter around the house, looking in cupboards. Suddenly the lights turn on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, we can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man is confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man goes to pick up the phone to call the police. Watts stops, turns and get's in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need for that, we are leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts, Zoe and Martha walk to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick appears behind the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, if you calm down no one will get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not stealing, we don't want anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just looking at the house. It's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't realize you were home. We wouldn't have come in otherwise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just Leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would but I can't be sure you won't call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't. You didn't take anything so just go, I just want my family to be safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safe? Why wouldn't anyone be safe. Unless you call the police, everything will be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I won't. You have my word, please just go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha walk outside. Patrick just stands there, he won't leave. Katie and Zoe walk out of the other room and are standing behind the Man. They don't move. He feels surrounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out of my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha looks back but the view is blocked by the door. No one knows what to do. The girls are looking to Patrick but he's not doing anything. Suddenly Katie lunges at the man and stabs him in the neck. Blood spurts out and she stabs him again in the ribs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all run out. 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha is in a small wood paneled room lying on a mattress. She is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks through the open door to see Katie and Watts washing in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick enters the bedroom and sits on her bed with Martha. Martha closes her eyes pretending to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick runs his hands through her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long silence. Martha is clearly not okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that death is the most beautiful part of life, right? Death is beautiful because everyone fears death. And fear is the greatest human emotion of all because it creates complete awareness. When you're scared it forces you to be completely aware of your surroundings and the moment you're in. It brings you to NOW and that makes you truly present. And when you are truly present, that's nirvana, that's pure love. So, death is pure love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha wakes up. Lucy is sitting on the bed. She has brought Tea. Martha sits up and takes a sip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too hot, let it cool for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, lies down and curls up again. She is half asleep. 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks mom. I'm sorry I ruined the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything was fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you slept through the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to drink the tea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy gets up and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men are moving vehicles into the garage. Women are bringing the clothes inside off the clothes line. Martha is helping with the garden. There is a sense of urgency  to close the farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is in the hayloft trying to close the loft door. He  slips and falls 30 feet to the ground. Martha rushes over to him. He is in pain. Watts comes out of the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fine. Right Max?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They help him up and he falls. He cant put pressure on his leg and he seems to have a concussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts! 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to do Marcy, you need to get inside. Max is strong, he'll be fine. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm good Marcy. Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone files into the basement except for Patrick, Watts and Katie. They stand at the top of the stairs talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do you think we'll be down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll just be a few days. Just to be safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is sleeping. Max is curled up in the corner. Martha walks over to him and wakes him. There is vomit in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you feel alright? If you hit your head  you shouldn't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know why we're down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think it was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It doesn't matter. 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still think about leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's cool now, I don't really have  anywhere to go. Why, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I just wanted to see about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie rings the dinner bell. Martha walks out of the house holding a large pot of soup. She walks it through the courtyard into the shed where everyone gathers to eat dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone from the farm stops work and walks towards the shed. It looks like more people are there than before, there are several new faces in the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha is cleaning the house. The phone rings, she picks it up. A young girl's voice is on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, is Watts there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is something written on the wall Martha reads.  Martha signals to a girl in the kitchen to go outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane. Is Watts there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this? 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Marlene Lewis. What's your last name Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heller, sorry, do I have the right number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha writes JANE HELLER on a list of names on the wall. Some of them have been scratched out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts comes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. How are you? Sure, yeah, let's do it, I'll be around there on Friday. No, that was my cousin Marlene, yeah, I'll see you in a bit then. Great, I'm glad you called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts hangs up. He and Martha have a quiet exchange and Watts walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha just stands there quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha cooks with Katie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha sneaks a bite of bread. Katie whacks her in the ear with a wooden spoon. A slight ringing remains throughout the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing till they're done. You know better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Sorry Katie.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Who's Katie? 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha turns her head to see Lucy instead of Katie. Martha is at the lake house cooking with Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Katie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this from the past or is this now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember waking up this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go sit down, I'll finish up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy hands water and some pills to Martha. Martha takes the pills, walks into the other room and collapses on the couch in front of the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted walks into the kitchen. Martha listens from the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches out and holds her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She needs to see someone. 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll start looking into places tomorrow. We can arrange for her to be somewhere by Wednesday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Places?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think she should stay with us anymore. We can't do anything for her when she's like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy goes back to chopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha and Zoe sit in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stop feeling terrible for that poor man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. It happens though, we're never really dead or alive, we just exist, so he's still existing, but it's in a parallel time. Just don't think about it, it's in the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha is upset with how cold Zoe is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha sits in the bathroom, knees pulled up to her chest as she rests on the edge of the bathtub.  75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone knocks at the door. She pretends not to be in  there. There is another gentle know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha, it's me, can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha unlocks the door for Zoe. Patrick bursts in, slams the door and corners Martha and yells at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you learned anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt like we had a connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what you're showing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick calms down. He sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I asked too much from you too soon. You have potential but you're just not there yet. I'll expect less of you fro now on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha is upset, like a trained animal, she runs back to his side, sits next to him and rests her head on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs his hand through her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his hand on the inside of her thigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my favorite, I won't lose you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha wakes up on the couch confused, she sees a man standing over her. She quickly pushes him up, jumps over tyhe back of the couch and runs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man is Ted. He follows her, trying to calm her down but she is in a blind state of panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs to the stairs. He follows her. She trips. He goes to see if she is okay. She kicks him. He falls down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights turn on. Lucy comes out of the bedroom to see Ted at the bottom of the stairs. She rushes over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted gets up slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted pushes Lucy off of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kicked me down the stairs. Jesus Christ, what's it going to take, Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha starts crying, she becomes hysterical. Lucy is irate, she runs up the stairs and confronts Martha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what, what are you so confused about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he was someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy's anger is building. 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought he was someone else? What is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not doing this anymore, I'm not doing this anymore. I beat myself up over you for years and I'm sick of it, I'm sick of chasing you down and worrying about you. I need to move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need help Martha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha shakes her head with a severe look of fear in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy doesn't know what else to do, she can see Martha is too far gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to get you proper help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long moment of silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to send me away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how to help you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't. Please don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help you. 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I can't be alone, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're trying to start a family and I don't trust you to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy stops at the bottom of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to be a terrible mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy freezes, she tries to stay calm but bursts into tears. There is a long, tense silence. Lucy dries her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any money left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll make sure everything is taken care of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy walks away, Martha is frozen on the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha walks through the house. All of the luggage is packed and sitting by the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted sits on the couch eating a sandwich and drinking a beer. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is an overcast, unusually cold Labor Day. Lucy works in the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going swimming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bit chilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we both said some things last night that we didn't mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We scheduled an appointment for you tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha looks into the back of the flower bed and notices footprints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it like there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha turns and walks down to the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're heading back to the city in about an hour. You'll be ready to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha stands on the dock. She strips down to her underwear and dives in. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha swims out into the lake. She drops under the water and out of sight, a burst of bubbles pop up to the surface. A few seconds pass by and she is not coming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly she breaks back through the water and gasps for air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around at the thick woods and a handful of nice homes that appear to be empty now. No one else is swimming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha sees a scruffy MAN sitting on a neighboring dock, he seems familiar. He is in his mid twenties, his jeans are rolled up and his feet dangle in the water. His shirt is slung over his shoulder and he smokes a cigarette. He looks directly at Martha. They make eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finishes his smoke, throws the cigarette in the water, puts on his shirt and just sits there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha swims back to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha sits in the back seat of Ted and Lucy's car. Ted drives and Lucy sits up front. They drive up the driveway and turn out onto the road. Ted and Lucy talk. Martha  gets a concerned look on her face. Ted slams on the  breaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking idiot. What was he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAN from the dock walks past the car. They almost hit him. As they drive away, Martha turns to see him get into the a brown car, start the engine and drive. The car drives behind Ted's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha looks forward for a long moment, then turns back again to see that he is still there. 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is frozen with fear, she thinks about saying something but then stops herself. Instead she sits in silence.
